Ingest_LDD.name: Imaging
Ingest_LDD.comment: This dictionary contains high level classes and attributes used in imaging and spectrometer products. It also contains classes with attributes used during active mission operations. Many of these classes are designed to be extended into local mission dictionaries.

DD_Attribute.name: command_sequence_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The command_sequence_number attribute provides a numeric identifier for a sequence of commands sent to a spacecraft or instrument.

DD_Attribute.name: downlink_telemetry_protocol_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The downlink_telemetry_protocol_type attribute specifies the protocol used by the source of a telemetry stream for creating telemetry data products.

Terminological_Entry.name: TELEMETRY_SOURCE_TYPE
Terminological_Entry.definition: The TELEMETRY_SOURCE_TYPE element classifies the source of the telemetry used in creation of this data set.

Terminological_Entry.name: MSL:TELEMETRY_SOURCE_TYPE
Terminological_Entry.definition: The MSL:TELEMETRY_SOURCE_TYPE element specifies the classification of the source of the telemetry used in creating this data set.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Standard Formatted Data Unit; used by Cassini, Phoenix, Insight
Data Product file delivery protocol; used by MER and MSL.
CCSDS File Delivery Protocol; used by MRO, Juno

DD_Attribute.name: telemetry_application_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The telemetry_application_id attribute identifies the process, or source, which created the data. This can include information such as an identification of the instrument which generated the telemetry stream, its operating mode at the time of data acquisition, and any onboard compression of the data.

Terminological_Entry.name: TELEMETRY_FORMAT_ID
Terminological_Entry.definition: The TELEMETRY_FORMAT_ID element supplies a telemetry format code.

Terminological_Entry.name: APPLICATION_PROCESS_ID
Terminological_Entry.definition: The APPLICATION_PROCESS_ID identifies the process, or source, which created the data.

Terminological_Entry.name: APPLICATION_PACKET_ID
Terminological_Entry.definition: The application_packet_id element identifies the telemetry packet queue to which the data were directed.

Terminological_Entry.name: TELEMETRY_APPLICATION_ID
Terminological_Entry.definition: The TELEMETRY_APPLICATION_ID element is used to link a data product (file) to a given application or structure description, when multiple formats exist within a single telemetry format.

DD_Attribute.name: telemetry_application_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The telemetry_application_name attribute provides the name associated with the source or process which created the data.

Terminological_Entry.name: APPLICATION_PROCESS_NAME
Terminological_Entry.definition: The APPLICATION_PROCESS_NAME element provides the name associated with the source or process which created the data.

Terminological_Entry.name: APPLICATION_PACKET_NAME
Terminological_Entry.definition:
The application_packet_name element provides the name associated with the telemetry packet queue to which data were directed.
Note: For Mars Pathfinder, the queues were distinguished on the basis of type and priority of data.

DD_Attribute.name: telemetry_application_subtype_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The telemetry_application_subtype_id attribute provides further distinction (i.e., greater specificity) among telemetry_application_id types.

Terminological_Entry.name: APPLICATION_PROCESS_SUBTYPE_ID
Terminological_Entry.definition: The APPLICATION_PROCESS_SUBTYPE_ID element identifies the source or subprocess that created the data.

Terminological_Entry.name: TELEMETRY_FMT_EXTENSION_TYPE
Terminological_Entry.definition: The TELEMETRY_FMT_EXTENSION_TYPE element provides additional information about what kind of telemetry was collected during scene looks versus calibration looks. Valid values are: LONG (Scene: Long Telemetry, Calibration: Long Telemetry) SHORT (Scene: Short Telemetry, Calibration: Short Telemetry) MIXED (Scene: Short Telemetry, Calibration: Long Telemetry)

DD_Attribute.name: telemetry_provider_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The telemetry_provider_id attribute identifies the organization or subsystem that supplied the telemetry data product to the producer of the raw (EDR) PDS data product. This is typically (but not always) the organization responsible for reassembling packetized data into a single product.

Terminological_Entry.name: TELEMETRY_PROVIDER_ID
Terminological_Entry.definition: The TELEMETRY_PROVIDER_ID element identifies the provider and or version of the telemetry data used in the generation of this data.

Terminological_Entry.name: TELEMETRY_PROVIDER_TYPE
Terminological_Entry.definition: The TELEMETRY_PROVIDER_TYPE element classifies the source of the telemetry used in creation of this data set.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Mission data Processing and Control System (used by MSL)
Front end Data Manager (used by JUNO and MRO)
The DSN's Telemetry Data (or Delivery) System (alternately, "Telemetry Data Staging")

DD_Attribute.name: earth_received_start_date_time
DD_Attribute.definition: The earth_received_start_date_time attribute provides the earliest time at which any component telemetry data for a particular product was received.

Terminological_Entry.name: EARTH_RECEIVED_START_TIME
Terminological_Entry.definition: The earth_received_start_time element provides the beginning time at which telemetry was received during a time period of interest. This should be represented in UTC system format. See also earth_received_time.

Terminological_Entry.name: EARTH_RECEIVED_TIME
Terminological_Entry.definition:
The earth_received_time element provides the time at which telemetry was received on earth. This should be represented in the UTC system format. For real time data, the difference between this time and the spacecraft_event_time is the signal travel time from the spacecraft to earth.
Formation rule: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.fff]

DD_Attribute.name: earth_received_stop_date_time
DD_Attribute.definition: The earth_received_stop_date_time attribute provides the latest time at which any component telemetry data for a particular product was received.

Terminological_Entry.name: EARTH_RECEIVED_STOP_TIME
Terminological_Entry.definition: The earth_received_stop_time element provides the ending time for receiving telemetry during a time period of interest. This should be represented in the UTC system format. See also earth_received_time.

DD_Attribute.name: crosstrack_summing
DD_Attribute.definition: The crosstrack_summing attribute provides the number of detector pixel values in the crosstrack direction that have been averaged to produce the final output pixel.

DD_Attribute.name: downtrack_summing
DD_Attribute.definition: The downtrack_summing attribute provides the number of detector pixel values in the downtrack direction that have been averaged to produce the final output pixel.

DD_Attribute.name: exposure_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The exposure count attribute provides the maximum number of exposures taken during a specified interval. The value is dependent on exposure type.

DD_Attribute.name: exposure_duration
DD_Attribute.definition: The exposure_duration attribute provides the value of the time interval between the opening and closing of an instrument aperture (such as a camera shutter).

DD_Attribute.name: exposure_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The exposure_type attribute indicates the exposure setting on a camera.

DD_Attribute.name: first_line
DD_Attribute.definition: The first_line attribute indicates the line within a source image that corresponds to the first line in a sub-image.

DD_Attribute.name: first_line_sample
DD_Attribute.definition: The first_line_sample attribute indicates the sample within a source image that corresponds to the first sample in a sub-image.

DD_Attribute.name: gain_mode_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The gain_mode_id attribute identifies the gain state of an instrument. Gain is a constant value which is multiplied with an instrument's output signal to increase or decrease the level of that output.

DD_Attribute.name: light_flood_state_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: The light_flood_state_flag attribute indicates the mode (on or off) of light flooding for an instrument.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The light flooding is "on" for the instrument.
The light flooding is "off" for the instrument.

DD_Attribute.name: offset_mode_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The offset_mode_id attribute identifies the analog value that is subtracted from the video signal prior to the analog/digital converters.

DD_Attribute.name: packet_creation_sclk
DD_Attribute.definition: The packet_creation_sclk attribute specifies the value of the spacecraft clock at the time that data was packetized on board a spacecraft. This value is not always co-incident with the data acquisition time.

Terminological_Entry.name: PACKET_CREATION_SCLK
Terminological_Entry.definition:
The PACKET_CREATION_SCLK specifies the value of the spacecraft clock at the time that data was packetized on board a spacecraft. This value is not always co-incident with the data acquisition time.
Note: for MPF and M98, this value was stored in the primary telemetry packet header of the first packet of a data file, and was the reference used for requesting the data packets from the TDS (Telemetry Delivery System).

DD_Attribute.name: packet_creation_date_time
DD_Attribute.definition: The packet_creation_date_time attribute specifies the time, in standard UTC format, that data was packetized on board a spacecraft. This value is not always co-incident with the data acquisition time.

DD_Attribute.name: expected_packets
DD_Attribute.definition: The expected_packets attribute provides the total number of telemetry packets which constitute a complete data product, i.e., a data product without missing data.

Terminological_Entry.name: EXPECTED_PACKETS
Terminological_Entry.definition: The expected_packets element provides the total number of telemetry packets which constitute a complete data product, i.e., a data product without missing data.

DD_Attribute.name: received_packets
DD_Attribute.definition: The received_packets attribute provides the total number of telemetry packets which constitute a reconstructed data product, cf. expected_packets.

DD_Attribute.name: missing_packet_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: The missing_packet_flag attribute indicates whether or not there were telemetry packets that were expected but not received.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: All telemetry packets that were expected were received.
All telemetry packets that were expected were received.
Some telemetry packets that were expected were not received.
Some telemetry packets that were expected were not received.

DD_Attribute.name: packet_map_mask
DD_Attribute.definition: The packet_map_mask attribute is a binary or hexadecimal number identifying which of a data file's expected packets were actually received. The digits correspond positionally with the relative packet numbers of the data file. The bits are to be read left to right; i.e., the first (left-most) digit of the number corresponds to the first packet of the data file. A bit value of 1 indicates that the packet was received; a value of 0 indicates that it was not received.

DD_Attribute.name: temperature_raw
DD_Attribute.definition: The temperature_raw attribute provides the raw, uncalibrated, temperature of some point on an instrument or other device.

DD_Attribute.name: temperature_calibrated
DD_Attribute.definition: The temperature_calibrated attribute provides the temperature, in the specified units, of some point on an instrument or other device.

DD_Attribute.name: filter_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The filter_name attribute provides the commonly-used name of the instrument filter through which an image or measurement was acquired or which is associated with a given instrument mode.

DD_Attribute.name: filter_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The filter_id attribute provides the number of an instrument filter through which an image or measurement was acquired or which is associated with a given instrument mode.

DD_Attribute.name: filter_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The filter_number attribute provides the numeric identifier of an instrument filter through which an image or measurement was acquired or which is associated with a given instrument mode. Within the bin class of a spectral data object, it identifies the filter through which data in the given band were acquired.

DD_Attribute.name: center_filter_wavelength
DD_Attribute.definition: The center_filter_wavelength attribute provides the mid_point wavelength value between the minimum and maximum instrument filter wavelength values.

DD_Attribute.name: full_width_half_maximum
DD_Attribute.definition: The full_width_half_maximum attribute describes the width of a "bump" on a curve or function. It is given by the distance between points on the curve at which the function reaches half of its maximum value.
DD_Attribute.comment: Weisstein, Eric W. "Full Width at Half Maximum." From MathWorld--A Wolfram Web Resource. http://mathworld.wolfram.com/FullWidthatHalfMaximum.html

DD_Attribute.name: producer_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The producer_id attribute provides a short name or acronym identifying the organization or team which produced a product. Ex. "LRO_LROC_TEAM", "MIPL of JPL"

DD_Attribute.name: producer_full_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The producer_full_name attribute provides the complete name for a person and includes titles and suffixes.

DD_Attribute.name: producer_institution_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The producer_institution_name attribute identifies a university, research center, national space agency, or other institution associated with the production of a PDS archive. This is generally an institution associated with the Producer_Name. Ex. "Max Planck Institute", "NASA/Goddard Space Flight Center"

DD_Attribute.name: version_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The version_id attribute provides the version of the software program.

DD_Attribute.name: user_id
DD_Attribute.definition: A short identifier used to run a computer process.

DD_Attribute.name: host_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The name of a computer on which a process was run.

DD_Class.name: Command_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Command_Parameters class contains attributes used to identify or describe the commands sent to a spacecraft to perform one or more actions resulting in the acquisition of the current data product.

DD_Class.name: Telemetry_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Telemetry_Parameters class contains downlink-related attributes used primarily during mission operations.

Terminological_Entry.name: Telemetry_Parameters
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Telemetry_Parameters class contains downlink-related attributes used primarily during mission operations.

DD_Class.name: Imaging_Instrument_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Imaging_Instrument_Parameters class contains attributes providing the values of any dynamic physical or operating characteristics of an instrument.

DD_Class.name: Processing_History
DD_Class.definition: The Processing_History class provides a listing of the programs used to create the current product.

DD_Class.name: Packet_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Packet_Parameters class contains parameters describing the packetized telemetry data.

DD_Class.name: Device_Temperature
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Temperature class provides the temperature of some point on an instrumnet or other device.

DD_Class.name: Filter
DD_Class.definition: The Filter class describes the filter associated with a particular observation. The filter may be identified by name, identifier, number or some combination of these.

DD_Class.name: Process
DD_Class.definition: The Process class describes an action taken upon a product, typically by a software program.

DD_Class.name: Process_Owner
DD_Class.definition: The Process_Owner class describes the individual and/or organization that made changes to a product.

DD_Class.name: Software
DD_Class.definition: The Software class identifies the software program used to make changes to a product.
